page.title: 08Crops and Animals
page.content: Mr Roy Harrold's farm in Stoke Holy Cross has animals an grows crops. The four crops grown are wheat, barley, sugar beet and hay. Other crops grown in this area include potatoes, beans and peas. The farmer has to plough and cultivate the soil, plant the seeds and then spray them to keep weeds and insects at bay. Then they have to be harvested, The fifty milking cows and fifty fat cattle bring in more money then the actual arable crops. The cattle have to be tended daily, and the farmer has to keep a sharp lookout for any diseases such as mastitis, and milk fever which would kill of not spotted at the right time. National membership of the European Economic Community affects the crops and animals very much.
